intro: Hypochaeris picroides, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces yellow flowers with a central disc surrounded by ray florets, and it typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. Hypochaeris picroides is an annual or biennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 cm, with alternate, hairy leaves. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize areas quickly, making it both a weed and a source of nectar for pollinators.
